PageTitle: peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib (BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view)(IPv6)
FuncDef:
The peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib command sets the maximum duration for a BGP restarter to wait for the End-of-RIB flag from a specified peer.
The undo peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib command deletes the configured duration. The peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib command sets the maximum duration for a BGP restarter to wait for the End-of-RIB flag from a specified peer. The undo peer graceful-restart timer wait-for-rib command deletes the configured duration. By default, a BGP restarter waits for the End-of-RIB flag from a specified peer for a maximum of 600s. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: BGP-VPN instance IPv6 address family view,BGP multi-instance VPN instance IPv6 address family view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv6 address of a peer.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies the maximum duration for waiting for the End-Of-RIB flag.
The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 3000, in seconds.

ExtraInfo: After the local device reestablishes a BGP session with a specified peer, the local device should receive the End-Of-RIB flag from the specified peer within the period specified by this command. If the local device does not receive the End-Of-RIB flag within the period specified by this command, the local device exits the GR process and selects the optimal route from the existing routes.
